column1: Falathar was one of three faithful companions who accompanied Eärendil on his mighty sea-voyages. He was with his captain when the ship Vingilot made its epic journey into the distant Aman
column2: to reach the Blessed Realm itself.

column1: While Eärendil and Elwing journeyed ashore
column2: Falathar remained aboard the ship with his fellows Erellont and Aerandir. After Eärendil had delivered his embassy to the Valar
column3: their emissary Eönwë came to the three mariners and set them in another boat. The Valar sent a wind out of the west to blow Falathar and his companions back across the Belegaer and
column5: they landed again somewhere in Middle-earth
column6: though their ultimate fate is not recorded.

column2: line of surf"). The ending is not explained

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien never specified the race of the three mariners: while it has been suggested that they were Men
column2: http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/a/aerandir.html Aerandir at http://www.glyphweb.com/arda/default.asp Encyclopedia of Arda (accessed 6 April 2011) others argue that they were Elves.http://www.twcenter.net/forums/showthread.php?t=347256&page=73 War of the Silmarils (game forum thread; accessed 6 April 2011)
